definition: on day duty
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
student on duty/prefect

sentences.english: I am the one on duty today.
Who is the student on duty today?
I am on duty and I also had four classes today.
sentences.chinese: 今天我值日，還上了四節課。

sentences.english: Who is on duty today? I am.
Please notify PTA immediately if you cannot perform the Parents on Duty due to schedule conflicts and any other problems.
sentences.chinese: 若預定值日時間無法當值，請立即告之家長會。

sentences.english: Helpers, please clean up the table.
sentences.chinese: 值日生，請把桌子擦乾淨。

sentences.english: I listen to the English songs while I stand there instead of having nothing to do.
sentences.chinese: 爲了防止無事可做，我邊聽英語歌曲邊做值日。

sentences.english: Where is the student who is on duty today?
sentences.chinese: 今天值日的學生在哪裏？

sentences.english: You ought to clean the classroom , for it is your turn today.
sentences.chinese: 你應該把教室打掃了，因爲今天是你值日。

sentences.english: The students on duty always come early.
Two other boys were on duty besides her.
sentences.chinese: 除了她之外，還有兩個男孩是值日生。

sentences.english: Students who are on duty today should erase the blackboard and prepare some chalk before the teachers come into the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 今天值日的同學要在老師到教室前擦黑板和準備粉筆。

sentences.english: Who is in charge of the class helper today?
sentences.chinese: 今天誰負責值日生的工作？

sentences.english: Returning to the front desk, I found Mary writing in a chart.
sentences.chinese: 回到前臺，我發現瑪麗正在值日表上寫着什麼。

definition: student on duty/prefect
to drill/to exercise/to go outdoors for physical exercise
to clean/to sweep
variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
to sweep the floor/to reach rock bottom/to be at an all-time low
to get food at a canteen
morning exercises (physical exercises commonly performed en masse at schools and workplaces in East Asian countries)
morning roll call
to divide people into groups, teams, squads etc
(Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
to arrange (shifts, runs, classes etc) in order
to work one's shift
matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
to work a shift/on duty
register of names/attendance roll book
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
